abstract: Combining BATS Global Markets and Direct Edge will vault the new company past Nasdaq to become the second-largest exchange operator in the United States, as the industry continues to face pressure to consolidate.
snippet: Combining BATS Global Markets and Direct Edge will vault the new company past Nasdaq to become the second-largest exchange operator in the United States, as the industry continues to face pressure to consolidate.
lead_paragraph: Several weeks ago, William O’Brien, the chief executive of the trading platform Direct Edge, and several of his senior managers flew discreetly to Kansas City, Mo. Waiting for them at the Charles B. Wheeler Downtown Airport there were Joe Ratterman, head of the rival BATS Global Markets, and his team.

headline.main: BATS and Direct Edge to Merge, Taking On Older Rivals
headline.print_headline: Two Exchanges to Merge, Taking On Larger Rivals

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Nathaniel Popper
